meanings.definition: A gum obtained from various Middle Eastern leguminous plants, used in the food industry as a thickening agent.
meanings.sent1: The chef used tragacanths to thicken the soup.
meanings.sent2: Tragacanths are commonly used in the food industry for their thickening properties.
meanings.sent3: The tragacanths in the recipe made the pudding extra creamy.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as tragacanths, thickening the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the tragacanths being added to the stew was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Astragalus, from which tragacanth gum is derived.
meanings.sent1: The farmer cultivated tragacanths in his field.
meanings.sent2: Tragacanths are known for their medicinal properties.
meanings.sent3: The garden was filled with colorful tragacanths swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bloomed like a field of tragacanths in spring.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the tragacanths filled the air with sweetness.
